intro: Amsinckia elongata, commonly known as the slender globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features slender, upright stems and produces showy yellow flowers with distinctive, inflated seed pods. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Amsinckia elongata is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance as a nectar source for pollinators.
